Package gui

Class StateTitle

java.lang.Object
gui.DefaultState
gui.StateTitle
All Implemented Interfaces:
State
public class StateTitle extends DefaultState
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the first stage where the user can select the skill-level. This class is part of a state pattern for the Controller class. It is a ConcreteState. It implements a state-dependent behavior that controls the display and reacts to key board input from a user. At this point user keyboard input is first dealt with a key listener (SimpleKeyListener) and then handed over to a Controller object by way of the keyDown method. Responsibilities: Show the title screen, Accept input for skill level, Switch to the generating screen, If given a filename, pass it on to the generating screen This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

  • Method Details

    • setFileName

      public void setFileName​(String filename)
      Sets the filename. Calling with null does not hurt but is pointless as maze will be then generated randomly, which is the default behavior anyway. The filename must be set before start is called or it will have no effect for this round of the game.
      Specified by:
      setFileName in interface State
      Overrides:
      setFileName in class DefaultState
      Parameters:
      filename - provides the name of a file to load a previously generated and stored maze from. Can be null.

    • start

      public void start​(Controller controller, MazePanel panel)
      Start the game by showing the title screen.
      Specified by:
      start in interface State
      Overrides:
      start in class DefaultState
      Parameters:
      controller - needed to be able to switch states, not null
      panel - is the UI entity to produce the title screen on

    • keyDown

      public boolean keyDown​(Constants.UserInput key, int value)
      Method incorporates all reactions to keyboard input in original code, The simple key listener calls this method to communicate input. Method requires start to be called before.
      Specified by:
      keyDown in interface State
      Overrides:
      keyDown in class DefaultState
      Parameters:
      key - provides the feature the user selected
      value - is only used to carry the skill level, the size of the maze. 0 <= value <= 16
      Returns:
